p.s: Everyone with a basic education of English language has heard of William Shakespeare.
But are the works of the playwright that lives more than 400 years ago, still relevant today or might they be outdated?
Shakespeare's works have already been translated into more than 100 languages worldwide.
There are most likely more languages to follow, which will have a major impact on world's literature even in the future.
Besides, Shakespeare influenced an important part of today's English language and he is told to have created 1700 - 2200 new words.
Shakespeare's works are about timeless topics like love, hate or family.
These topics will also play a role for future generations which still makes Shakespeare relevant.
On the other side, it is to be said that students suffer more and more to understand the special and unique style of writing, which was different to the known English even back in the 16th century.
Another argument for Shakespeare's work being outdated is that it is irrelevant today, as we are facing enormous challenges like climate change or a growing population.
There are thousands of authors who write important and famous books.
Why should today's students not read a story from somebody alive that refers to the globalized world or an even picture of male and female, unlike Shakespeare?
In my opinion, Shakespeare was a genius far beyond his time.
He influenced a lot of other authors and the English language in the last 400 years.

But on the other hand students suffer reading his work, topics with growing relevance and books about these topics exist and there are thousands of authors worldwide that may have a chance of creating an impact as Shakespeare has until now.
We should give these authors a chance and start a new chapter in literature, in which you can spot pieces of Shakespeare's impact, but also new works by new authors.
